record.title: FLOOD INSURANCE REFORM AND MODERNIZATION ACT OF 2007--MOTION TO PROCEED
record.narrative:
FLOOD INSURANCE REFORM AND MODERNIZATION ACT OF 2007--MOTION TO PROCEED -- (Senate - May 02, 2008)

[Page: S3742]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I now move to proceed to Calendar No. 460, S. 2284, the National Flood Insurance Act Amendments.

Before sending a cloture motion to the desk, I told the minority leader yesterday I was filing this and that this would be the thing we would go to as soon as we finish FAA. I hope that it is not necessary to have a vote for cloture. I hope they will allow us to move to FAA on Tuesday. If they do, we will proceed quickly to move to this flood insurance act.
Mr. President, I sent a cloture motion to the desk.

record.chair: The clerk will report the motion.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:

We, the undersigned Senators, in accordance with the provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, hereby move to bring to a close debate on the motion to proceed to Calendar No. 460, S. 2284, the National Floor Insurane Act Amendments.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent, notwithstanding an adjournment of the Senate, that Monday, May 5, count as the intervening day under rule XXII; further, that this cloture vote not occur prior to the previously ordered cloture vote on the Rockefeller substitute amendment No. 4627; provided further, that the mandatory quorum be waived, and I now withdraw the motion.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
